parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Detection </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the nearest object of given type (or inherited classes) to given position within a sphere. Hardcoded radius is 50 meters. Unlike with [[nearestObjects]], where distance is measured in 2D space, [[nearestObject]] will be closest object in 3D space.

<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative </title><part><name index="1"/><value>
* in OFP, only objects of the exact provided class are found.
* if an object ID is used (Alternative Syntax 3, see '''Example 2''') the search range is unlimited</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[nearestObject]] [position, type] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> [position, type]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> position:  [[Position3D]] or [[Position2D]] or [[Object]] - position to start search at </value></part><part><name>Parameter2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> type: [[String]] - type of object (see [[typeOf]], [[CfgVehicles|class type]]) </value></part><part><name>Parameter3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Object]] - Nearest object, [[objNull]] otherwise </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [[nearestObject]] position </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> position: [[Position3D]] or [[Position2D]] - position to start search at </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Object]] - Nearest object, [[objNull]] otherwise </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>s3</name>=<value> position [[nearestObject]] type </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX3</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p41</name>=<value> position: [[Position3D]] or [[Position2D]] - position to start search at </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER41</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p42</name>=<value> type: [[String]] - type of object (see [[typeOf]], [[CfgVehicles|class type]]) </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER42</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r3</name>=<value> [[Object]] - nearest object, [[objNull]] otherwise </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE3</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>s4</name>=<value> position [[nearestObject]] id </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX4</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p61</name>=<value> position: [[Position3D]] or [[Position2D]] - position to start search at </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER61</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p62</name>=<value> id: [[Number]] - object Visitor id </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER62</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r4</name>=<value> [[Object]] - nearest object, [[objNull]] otherwise </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE4</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_nObject = [[nearestObject]] [2345, 6789];
_nObject = [[nearestObject]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[player]], "StreetLamp"];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Return the object with ID 123456:
<code>_nObject = [0,0,0] [[nearestObject]] 123456;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_nObject = [[getPos]] [[player]] [[nearestObject]] "StreetLamp"; </code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value> Return the nearest object with ([[typeOf]] _nObject == "#XXXX") -> #mark, #slop, etc. Unlimited search range:
<code>_nObject = _position [[nearestObject]] -1; </code>

Return the nearest object with ([[typeOf]] _nObject != ""). Search range is 50m:
<code>_nObject = [[nearestObject]] _position;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE4</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x5</name>=<value> (See also [[allMissionObjects]]):
<code>_blood  = [[nearestObject]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[player]], "#slop"];
_step   = [[nearestObject]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[player]], "#mark"];
_track  = [[nearestObject]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[player]], "#track"];
_crater = [[nearestObject]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[player]], "#crater"];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE5</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[nearestObjects]], [[nearObjectsReady]], [[nearObjects]], [[objectFromNetId]], [[nearEntities]], [[entities]], [[object]], [[nearestBuilding]], [[nearestTerrainObjects]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 29, 2019 - 15:31 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Gnashes|Gnashes]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
The ID for Alternative Syntax 3 may be dynamically obtained via the following (as of Arma 3 v1.88):
<code><template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>returns Object Terrain/Visitor ID, or -1 if no ID found (invalid/null object)</value></part></template>
[[cursorObject]] [[call]] {
	[[private]] _obj [[=]] [[str]] ([[param]] [0, [[objNull]]]);
	[[private]] _id [[=]] -1;

	[[private]] _find [[=]] ((_obj [[find]] "#") + 2);
	[[if]] (_find > 1) [[then]] {
		[[private]] _len [[=]] ((_obj [[find]] ":") - _find); 
		_id [[=]] _obj [[select]] [_find, _len];
		[[parseNumber]] _id;
	};
	_id
};</code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes -->
</comment>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on February 12, 2020 - 08:55 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:blackfisch|blackfisch]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Note, that if you want to check for the nearest Unit you have to check for <template><title>Inline code</title><part><name index="1"/><value>CAManBase</value></part></template> instead of <template><title>Inline code</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Man</value></part></template>, since <template><title>Inline code</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Man</value></part></template> will also return any wildlife population in that Area:

<code>nearestObject [player, "Man"]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>could possibly return rabbits or other wildlife</value></part></template>

nearestObject [player, "CAManBase"]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>only returns units</value></part></template>
</code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
